hints.content:
There are $\color{green}12\color{black}$ cans in $\color{blue}3$ equal rows.

How can we find out how many cans are in each row?

We can find how many cans are in each row by dividing:

$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}$

So, $\color{green}12}\div\color{blue}3}$

The following expression will tell us how many soups cans are in each row:

- $\color{green}12\color{black}\div\color{blue}3$

question.content:
There are $12$ soup cans placed in $3$ equal rows.

 

**Which expression will tell us how many soup cans are in each row?**

We can relate division to arrays:

$$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}=\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}}$$$
$\color{green}36\color{black} \div \color{purple}9$ equals $\color{green}36\color{black}$ total dots split into rows of $\color{purple}9$.
This array has $\color{green}36\color{black}$ total dots split into rows of $\color{purple}9$.

options: [An array of green dots arranged in 4 rows of 9 dots each. ]
[An array of orange dots arranged in 5 rows of 9 dots each.]
[An array of blue dots arranged in 9 rows of 3 dots each.]
correctAnswers: [An array of green dots arranged in 4 rows of 9 dots each. ]

hints.content:
We can relate division to arrays:

$$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}$
$\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ number of objects in each row}\color{black}=\color{blue}\text{ number of rows}}$
$$

There are $\color{blue}2$ rows with $\color{purple}9$ dots in each row.
There are $\color{green}18\color{black}$ total dots.

$$
$\color{green}18\color{black}\text{ total dots}&\div ~\color{purple}9\text{ dots in each row}= \color{blue}2\text{ rows}$
$\color{green}18\color{black}\text{ total dots}&\div \color{blue}2\text{ rows}  ~=\color{purple}9\text{ dots in each row}$
$$

The following expressions represent the array:

- $\color{green}18\color{black}\div\color{purple}9$
- $\color{green}18\color{black}\div\color{blue}2$
